content: race for life 2009- easy cap yarn 1x 50 gm 100m using 5 mm circular needle cast on 80 90 debonnaire soft spun stitches place marker and join into round making baby alpaca/extra fine sure stitches sts are not twisted on the needle merino yarn pictured demure beige and glee colour ways work lacey edge as follows round 1 * k1 yo k3 sk2p k3 yo repeat from* across needles 2x 5mm 40cm round 2 k circular needles or dpns repeat rnds 1&2 3x total gauge next k every round until cap measures approx 4 ½ 5 sts/6 row = 1 in st st in length and then begin crown shaping change to dpn s or add another circular needle when sts no size xs/sm- fits head longer stretch comfortably around 1 needle if circumference to 20 desired hat may be knit max another inch without m/l- heads over 20 - directions in increasing yarn requirements length as pictured is approx 7 decrease round 1 * k2tog k12 k11 ssk repeat from* across next k 2 rnds without decreasing note see below for round 4 * k2tog k10 k9 ssk repeat from* hints for working with 2 continue to decrease every 3rd round as above working 2 less circular needles sts each decrease round until the round where there are debonnaire 25 perrymead street london sw6 3sn phone 078 87 994 351 2 1 sts between the decreases k 2 rounds then k2tog across for 2 rounds = 5 sts cut yarn and draw through remaining sts weave loose ends on top and cast on edge through back purl bumps wet block hat gently pin out and allow to dry notes working on 2 circular needles- cast on specified sts loosely using needle 1 transfer ½ of these sts purlwise to 2nd circular needle slide sts to other end of needle sts should now be arranged so that yarn is on back needle coming from the right side of work between the 2 needles push needle 1 sts to the tip make sure sts are not twisted when joining round to join round either swap first sts on each needle or just start knitting bring free end of the same needle to front and right hand and work across sts rotate work so sts on needle 2 are facing you slide needle 1 sts to cable and then work across sts on needle 2 as before a round is completed when sts on both needles are worked each needle knits its own sts be sure to start new side with other end of the same needle the first few row can be fiddly but persevere and the sts will stop trying to flop around the needle after just a few rounds this method is particularly useful when working the top of hats where there are too few sts to stretch comfortably around 1 needle- slip ½ of total sts remaining purlwise to another circular and continue to decrease for crown
